intro: Sciaplea, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. Sciaplea species typically produce small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in the early morning and close by midday. They are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their succulent leaves and deep root systems.
